snippet: John Kerry suggested that major sanctions might be lifted before international inspectors get answers to questions about Iranian experiments and work that appeared aimed at developing a bomb.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry signals for first time that United States may lift economic sanctions imposed on Iran without fully resolving evidence suggesting that Iranian scientists have been working on nuclear weapons in secret.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: John Kerry suggested that major sanctions might be lifted before international inspectors get answers to questions about Iranian experiments and work that appeared aimed at developing a bomb.

headline.main: U.S. Could Lift Sanctions Before Iran Accounting
headline.print_headline: U.S. Could Lift Sanctions Before Iran Accounting

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
